filters

Class NodeFilter_SurvivalHorizon

  • java.lang.Object
    • filters.NodeFilter_SurvivalHorizon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    INodeFilter

    public class NodeFilter_SurvivalHorizon
extends Object
implements INodeFilter
    Filters nodes based on survival past them to a specified horizon. For example, with a specified horizon of 5, only nodes with descendants at least 5 layers deeper in the tree would be accepted. All others would be filtered.
    Author:
    matt

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NodeFilter_SurvivalHorizon(int requiredSurvivalHorizon)
      Creates a new node filter which keeps only nodes who have descendants deep enough beyond them.

      Decide if this node should be included or filtered out.

    • Constructor Detail

      • NodeFilter_SurvivalHorizon

        public NodeFilter_SurvivalHorizon(int requiredSurvivalHorizon)
        Creates a new node filter which keeps only nodes who have descendants deep enough beyond them.
        Parameters:
        requiredSurvivalHorizon - Survival horizon beyond the query node required to keep the node and not filter it out.

    • Method Detail

      • filter

        public boolean filter(Node node)
        Description copied from interface: INodeFilter
        Decide if this node should be included or filtered out. If not overridden, this will default to true.
        Specified by:
        filter in interface INodeFilter
        Parameters:
        node - Node to apply filtering rules to.
        Returns:
        Whether this node should be kept. True means keep. False means filter out.
